perturbation.original_text: Section 6.1 of the Agreement shall be, and hereby is, amended by deleting the date "September 30, 2003" where it appears therein, and inserting in its place the date "July 20, 2006".
perturbation.changed_text: Section 6.1 of the Agreement shall be, and hereby is, amended by deleting the date "September 30, 2003" where it appears therein, and inserting in its place the date "December 31, 2004".
perturbation.explanation: Extending the agreement term to 2006 might have tax or regulatory consequences depending on the type of agreement and any underlying permits or licenses. Shortening it to 2004 may not provide sufficient time for the manager to recoup their investment, potentially violating implied duties of good faith and fair dealing or specific California laws relating to contract duration and termination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing; potential violations of California contract law concerning reasonable contract duration and termination.

perturbation.original_text: If the LIFO Partners shall inform the Manager in writing of an agreement among them concerning the priority of the curtailment of their respective Projects, the Manager shall effect any curtailment under these provisions according to such priority. If the LIFO Partners fail to so inform the Manager, the Manager shall in its discretion determine which of the Projects of the LIFO Partners to curtail.
perturbation.changed_text: If the Manager determines that curtailment is necessary, the Manager will have the sole and absolute discretion to curtail the Projects of any Partner, regardless of any agreements or objections from the Partners. The Manager is not obligated to provide any notice or justification for such curtailment.
perturbation.explanation: This modification allows the manager to curtail projects without regard to agreements between partners, potentially violating California's partnership laws, which require partners to act in the best interest of the partnership and respect the terms of the partnership agreement. Removing the requirement for notice or justification also conflicts with implied duties of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Corporations Code regarding partnership duties; Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.

perturbation.original_text: In connection with any attempt to eliminate the cause of any curtailment, no change to the Transmission Line shall be made without the prior unanimous consent of the Partners (excluding the LIFO Partners), which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
perturbation.changed_text: The Manager has the sole discretion to make any changes to the Transmission Line deemed necessary, without requiring consent from any of the Partners. The Manager is not liable for any damages or losses resulting from such changes.
perturbation.explanation: This change eliminates the requirement for unanimous consent for changes to the transmission line, potentially violating California contract law if those changes negatively affect the profitability or operation of any partner's project and are made without reasonable justification. This also eliminates any implied duty of the Manager to act in the best interest of the partners regarding the Transmission Line which would likely violate the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing. It contradicts generally accepted California contract principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California contract law regarding unilateral contract modifications and breach of contract; Implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.
